thread.title: Guardians sign 2 key starters, avoiding arbitration - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: Guardians sign 2 key starters, avoiding arbitration - NewsBreak

title: Guardians sign 2 key starters, avoiding arbitration - NewsBreak
text:
By Chad Krispinsky ,
2 hours ago
CLEVELAND (WKBN) — The Cleveland Guardians have officially signed outfielders Steven Kwan and Lane Thomas to one-year deals, avoiding arbitration.
According to Cleveland.com, the contract for Thomas is worth $7.825 million.
Meanwhile, KPRC’s Ari Alexander is reporting that Kwan’s deal is valued at $4.175 million.
Last season, Thomas was acquired by Cleveland in a trade with the Washington Nationals. Between Cleveland and Washington last season, Thomas posted a batting average of .237 with 15 home runs, 63 RBIs and 32 stolen bases.
Kwan won a Gold Glove for the third straight season in 2024. The All-Star appeared in 122 games with Cleveland, batting .292 with 14 homers, 44 RBIs and 12 steals.
